text: Fred William Cox (December 11, 1938 â€“ November 20, 2019) was an American kicker for the Minnesota Vikings. He played college football at Pitt. He was also the inventor of the Nerf football. Cox died on November 20, 2019 in Monticello, Minnesota of kidney disease at the age of 80.Vikings Mourn Passing of Legendary Kicker, NERF Football Inventor Fred Cox ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from kidney disease Category:Sportspeople from Pennsylvania Category:American football placekickers Category:American inventors Category:Minnesota Vikings players
